meanings.definition: The quality of having a large amount of mass.
meanings.sent1: The massinesses of the boulder made it impossible to move.
meanings.sent2: The elephant's massinesses made it challenging to lift.
meanings.sent3: The massinesses of the cake made it a struggle to carry to the party.
meanings.sent4: The massinesses of the silence in the room was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The massinesses of the fog enveloped the entire valley.

meanings.definition: The state of being heavy or bulky.
meanings.sent1: Carrying the massinesses of the suitcase up the stairs was exhausting.
meanings.sent2: The massinesses of the old furniture made it hard to rearrange the room.
meanings.sent3: The massinesses of the backpack caused the student to stumble.
meanings.sent4: The massinesses of the traffic slowed down the commute.
meanings.sent5: The massinesses of the storm clouds darkened the sky.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being dense or substantial.
meanings.sent1: The massinesses of the bookshelf made it sturdy and reliable.
meanings.sent2: The massinesses of the tree trunk indicated its age and strength.
meanings.sent3: The massinesses of the soup filled the room with a comforting aroma.
meanings.sent4: The massinesses of the mountain loomed in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The massinesses of the building gave it a sense of permanence.
